description.narrative: Projektet syftar till att förbättra fjärrvärmesystemet i Pristina genom att koppla kraftverket Kosovo B till värmesystemet i Pristina. Detta är ett miljövänligt och ekonomiskt effektivit sätt att använda Kosovo B och få värme till Kosovos huvudstad.

The aim is through a co-generation project to improve the efficiency of the heating system in Kosovo. This is an environmental and cost efficient way to use the Kosovo B power plant for heating needs in Kosovo.

• Reduction of the operative cost of the district heating company Prishtina by around 50%.• Full replacement of heavy oil by steam of the power plant Kosovo B, i.e.• large reduction of pollution and CO2 emissions (by 60,000 tons p.a.) by reducing the loss of heat and water and increasing the energy efficiency.• Significant reduction of electricity demand from households for heating, thereby substantial decrease of electricity shortfall of Kosovo.• Improvement of the supply for the consumers with heat from the district heating network.• Institutional strengthening of the district heat provider.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The intervention gave immediate positive results and it is considered one of the most successful capital investments in Kosovo. Pristina district heating public enterprise “Termokos” has a network comprised of approximately 12 thousand customers. For many years, the district heating was not operational due to major problems in management, heavy fuel oil supply, damages to the network, and non-payment of invoices by the customers. The use of the steam of “Kosova B” powerplant to provide heating for the number of households, resulted in an immediate resolution of numerous technical and financial challenges of this public enterprise. Following results have been achieved through this intervention: Improvement of Pristina district heating service to existing customers. Substitution of electricity and fuelwood for heating. Electricity consumption has decreased by 34%, the collection rate increased by 176%, and the dissatisfaction of customers towards the heating quality, decreased from 94% to 8% within a year. Expansion of district heating coverage area in the city of Pristina. Reduction of fuel consumption (heavy oli-mazut). Improvement of energy efficiency. Reducing costs of heating production. Improvement of air quality in the city. reduced CO2 emissions.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
